intro: Phyteuma halleri f. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy phyteuma, is a flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped, usually blue or purple flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
